subject: Cybersecurity
title: The Morris Worm: The Internet's First Major Attack
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Morris Worm: The Internet's First Major Attack usable.

hook.text: In 1988, a Cornell grad student accidentally brought down 10% of the entire internet.

buildup.text: Robert Morris released a worm to measure the internet's size. A coding bug made it replicate out of control.

discovery.text: The worm infected 6,000 machines â€” roughly 10% of the internet â€” causing millions in damage.

twist.text: Morris became the first person convicted under the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act. He later became an MIT professor.

climax.text: The Morris Worm proved that a single mistake could cascade across an entire network.

punchline.text: The internet's first disaster was an experiment gone wrong.

quiz.question: What percentage of the internet did the Morris Worm infect?
